ygData.subject: RE: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please  ]
ygData.msgSnippet: Would a Gnoll Hide Lariat be worth using for the stun affect? Tomerrilin ... From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@yahoo.com] Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 2:09
ygData.messageBody:
Would a Gnoll Hide Lariat be worth using for the stun affect?

Tomerrilin

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 2:09 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please ]



Great ideas...expensive items for a lvl 11 tho --
maybe get some guild help on getting this stuff?


--- Sylly Songsynger <jgs@...> wrote:
> Stop by the local magic shop and buy some egg shaped
> pumice stones. Save
> one for breaking root and use the other for
> de-spelling his buffs on him
> and/or pet. Do lev 15 mages have damage shields?
> There might be some other
> items you can get there that would be handy... invis
> portions (and sit to
> regen hp - can you bandage your self while invis?),
> shadow step potions, not
> too sure if any of the healing/regen ones are any
> good or not - one
> heal/regen also roots you - heh, cast that on him to
> root him or drag his
> pet away and root it and then see if your CoD and
> weps can beat the healing
> effects?
>
> Sounds like a fun event!
>
> Sylly
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <kim@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 12:11 PM
> Subject: RE: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please ]
>
>
> > On Thu, 13 Apr 2000, Webber, Jessica wrote:
> > > Melodii wrote:
> > > > I'm lined up to fight a lvl 15 mag. Hmmmm....
>
> > If you don't want to be quite so dirty, I'd drag
> the pet away,
> > run back and attack the mage, drag the pet away
> again when it
> > returns, repeat. You can use Warsong and melee to
> hope to
> > interrupt his casting, or Accel to try to get out
> of range
> > before his spell fires (note that neither consumes
> mana, so
> > you'd be relying on fizzles to deplete his mana).
> And if the
> > pet roots you...
>
> pumice stones - dont leave home without one
>
>
> > The key I think is that you can stay out of attack
> range and
> > heal indefinitely, while he cannot (gotta run out
> of bandages
> > some time).
>
>
>
